thread.title: GAMING: Goal Star Strikers - weekend predictions
thread.title_full: GAMING: Goal Star Strikers - weekend predictions

title: GAMING: Goal Star Strikers - weekend predictions
text:
0 25-Feb-2017 00:40:00 Sadio Mane, Edinson Cavani and Arjen Robben head our list of probable goal scorers in the next round of Goal Star Strikers. Mane was the match winner for Liverpool when they beat Tottenham in their last Premier League game, he features in this week’s Goal Star Strikers: The goal scorer prediction game where you can win £250. PLAY FOR FREE 
It’s completely free to play the game; you just need to be the first to pick 7 anytime goal scorers from the list of Star Strikers and you could win £250 in Amazon Vouchers. Just remember to confirm your entry by registering for Goal, you must register to enter the competition and qualify for the prize. 
This week’s round includes players from Europe’s top leagues. To give you some tips on who to pick, our Fantasy Football scout share his selection based on the current form, shooting accuracy and goal scoring record. Sadio Mane 
Mane scored both goals in the victory over Spurs at Anfield, he will look to add to his goal tally when the Reds visit struggling Leicester City on Monday night. He scored in the reverse fixture earlier in the season. Mane has scored 6 goals from 22 appearances and has a shooting accuracy of 39%. Pick Mane to score. Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang 
Aubameyang opened the scoring when Dortmund hosted Freiburg in the Bundesliga earlier this season. The Gabon forward was guilty of wasting chances against Benfica in mid-week, but he has scored 4 goals in the last 3 games against Freiburg. He has scored 17 goals from 19 appearances this season and has a shooting accuracy of 67%. Pick Aubameyang to score. Andy Carroll 
The West Ham forward has had an injury hit season but is finding some form, and scored in the Hammers last away game at Southampton. West Ham travel to Watford on Saturday in what is likely to be a hard fought game. The Englishman has scored 6 goals from 12 games this season and has a shooting accuracy of 42%. Pick Carroll to score. Edinson Cavani 
The Uruguayan has been brilliant for PSG, scoring 25 league goals in 24 games. He had scored in 7 consecutive games until last week’s goalless draw against Toulouse. PSG are away to Marseille in Ligue 1 this weekend, the teams played out a goalless draw earlier in the season but expect goals at the Stade Velodrome this weekend. Cavani is converting 33% of his shots and has a shooting accuracy of 57%. Pick Cavani to score. Arjen Robben 
The Dutch winger scored a great goal in the demolition of Arsenal in mid-week and he will look to add to his tally of 7 league goals when Bayern host Hamburg in the Bundesliga on Saturday. Robben has scored 2 goals in his last 3 games and has a shooting accuracy of 52%. Pick Robben to score. Pedro 
Chelsea’s Spanish forward has found a new lease of life under Antonio Conte and has scored in his last 2 appearances for the Blues. Pedro has 6 goals in 22 appearances this season, converting 1 in 4 shots with a shooting accuracy of 39%. The Premier League leaders host Swansea on Saturday. Pick Pedro to score. Romelu Lukaku 
Lukaku scored 4 goals in Everton’s last home game against Bournemouth. This week he will come up against a Sunderland team he scored 3 against earlier in the season. The Belgian has 16 goals from 24 appearances this season and has an impressive 65% shooting accuracy. Pick Lukaku to score. 
Do you agree with these selections? Who will you pick? Select your Star Strikers HERE Related
